alert.note: Alert for Lake Mead NRA, Colorado River-AZ side; Northwest Deserts, Northwest Plateau (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued June 16 at 11:30AM MST until June 17 at 11:00PM MST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 11 PM FRIDAY FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY FOR MOST OF SOUTHERN NEVADA AND NORTHWEST ARIZONA... ...RED FLAG WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 9 PM SATURDAY FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY FOR MOST OF SOUTHERN NEVADA AND NORTHWEST ARIZONA... The National Weather Service in Las Vegas has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect from 11 AM to 11 PM Friday and 11 AM to 9 PM Saturday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * TIMING...Critical fire conditions are primarily expected in the late morning through early evening hours. * WIND...Sustained winds of 20 to 30 mph with gusts to 50 mph. Stronger wind gusts possible across the Southern Great Basin. * HUMIDITY...Minimum relative humidity values of 5 to 12 percent. Slight improvements to humidity values are possible in eastern Mohave County Saturday...but still in the 10 to 20 percent range. * IMPACTS...A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior. Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now...or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Lake Mead NRA, Colorado River-AZ side; Northwest Deserts, Northwest Plateau
